item.title: Introduction to Proxies
item.description: Introduction This week I worked on adding a network proxy to our backend architecture. Today we will talk about what a network proxy is, why it is useful, and how we built ours. What even is a proxy? A proxy is a service that sits in front of another computer and forwards network messages on behalf of that computer. Similar to how a proxy voter might vote on behalf of a person - a proxy server sends and receives network traffic on behalf of another server.
